javadoc:
Class to represent a processor register.  To sort of handle bit registers, a
 special addressing convention is used.  First the upper bit is set.  Second, the
 next 3 bits are used to specify what bit position within a byte that this register
 bit exists at.  Finally, the rest of the address is the address of the byte where
 the register bit lives.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Constructs a new Register object.

params.name: address
params.comment: the address in register space of this register

params.name: numBytes
params.comment: the size (in bytes) of this register

params.name: bigEndian
params.comment:
true if the most significant bytes are associated with the lowest register
 addresses, and false if the least significant bytes are associated with the lowest register 
 addresses.

params.name: typeFlags
params.comment:
the type(s) of this Register  (TYPE_NONE, TYPE_FP, TYPE_SP, 
 	TYPE_PC, TYPE_CONTEXT, TYPE_ZERO);)

methods.javadoc:
Add register alias
@param aliasReg
methods.name: addAlias
methods.comment: Add register alias

methods.javadoc:
Remove register alias
@param alias
methods.name: removeAlias
methods.comment: Remove register alias

methods.javadoc:
Return register aliases.
 NOTE: This is generally only supported for
 context register fields.
@return register aliases or null
methods.name: getAliases
methods.comment:
Return register aliases.
 NOTE: This is generally only supported for
 context register fields.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the name of this Register.
@return the name of this Register.
methods.name: getName
methods.comment: Gets the name of this Register.

methods.javadoc:
Get the description of the Register.
@return the description of the register
methods.name: getDescription
methods.comment: Get the description of the Register.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the total number of bits for this Register.
@return the total number of bits for this Register.
methods.name: getBitLength
methods.comment: Gets the total number of bits for this Register.

return.comment: the total number of bits for this Register.

methods.javadoc: Returns the minimum number of bytes required to store a value for this Register.
methods.name: getMinimumByteSize
methods.comment: Returns the minimum number of bytes required to store a value for this Register.

methods.javadoc: Returns the offset into the register space for this register
methods.name: getOffset
methods.comment: Returns the offset into the register space for this register

methods.javadoc:
Returns the bit offset from the register address for this register.
@return the bit offset from the register address for this register.
methods.name: getLeastSignificantBit
methods.comment: Returns the bit offset from the register address for this register.

return.comment: the bit offset from the register address for this register.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if this is the default frame pointer register
methods.name: isDefaultFramePointer
methods.comment: Returns true if this is the default frame pointer register

methods.javadoc:
Returns true for a register whose context value should
 follow the disassembly flow.
methods.name: followsFlow
methods.comment:
Returns true for a register whose context value should
 follow the disassembly flow.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if this is a hidden register.
methods.name: isHidden
methods.comment: Returns true if this is a hidden register.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if this is the program counter register
methods.name: isProgramCounter
methods.comment: Returns true if this is the program counter register

methods.javadoc: Returns true if this is a processor state register
methods.name: isProcessorContext
methods.comment: Returns true if this is a processor state register

methods.javadoc: Returns true for a register that is always zero
methods.name: isZero
methods.comment: Returns true for a register that is always zero

methods.javadoc: @see java.lang.Object#toString()
methods.name: toString

methods.javadoc: @see java.lang.Object#equals(java.lang.Object)
methods.name: equals

methods.javadoc: @see java.lang.Object#hashCode()
methods.name: hashCode

methods.javadoc: Returns the register address space
methods.name: getAddressSpace
methods.comment: Returns the register address space

methods.javadoc: @see java.lang.Comparable#compareTo(java.lang.Object)
methods.name: compareTo

methods.javadoc: Returns the address of the register.
methods.name: getAddress
methods.comment: Returns the address of the register.

methods.javadoc:
Returns list of children registers sorted by
 lest-significant bit-offset within this register.
methods.name: getChildRegisters
methods.comment:
Returns list of children registers sorted by
 lest-significant bit-offset within this register.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the mask that indicates which bits in the base register apply to this register.
@return the mask that indicates which bits in the base register apply to this register
methods.name: getBaseMask
methods.comment: Returns the mask that indicates which bits in the base register apply to this register.

return.comment: the mask that indicates which bits in the base register apply to this register

methods.name: contains
methods.comment:
Determines if reg is contained within this register.
 Method does not work for bit registers (e.g., context-bits)

return.comment:
true if reg equals this register or is contained
 within it.

methods.name: isVectorRegister
methods.comment: Returns true if this is a vector register

return.comment:
true precisely when  is a full vector register (i.e., a register that can be
 used as input or output for a SIMD operation).

methods.name: isValidLaneSize
methods.comment: Determines whether  is a valid lane size for this register.

params.name: laneSizeInBytes
params.comment: lane size to check, measured in bytes

return.comment: true precisely when  is a vector register and  is a valid lane size.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the sorted array of lane sizes for this register, measured in bytes.
@return array of lane sizes, or {@code null} if {@code this} is not a vector register or no lane sizes have been set.
methods.name: getLaneSizes
methods.comment: Returns the sorted array of lane sizes for this register, measured in bytes.

return.comment: array of lane sizes, or  if  is not a vector register or no lane sizes have been set.

methods.name: addLaneSize
methods.comment: Adds a lane size.

name: Register
comment:
Class to represent a processor register.  To sort of handle bit registers, a
 special addressing convention is used.  First the upper bit is set.  Second, the
 next 3 bits are used to specify what bit position within a byte that this register
 bit exists at.  Finally, the rest of the address is the address of the byte where
 the register bit lives.

fields.javadoc: Register can be used in SIMD operations
fields.name: TYPE_VECTOR
fields.comment: Register can be used in SIMD operations
